task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 9°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see its full vertical structure; rotating upward will reveal the roofline while maintaining the current heading toward the target building.
To estimate the building's height, I need to see both the base and roof in the same vertical field of view; pitching down will reveal the ground level to establish the full vertical span.

To capture the full vertical span of the building, I need to adjust the pitch upward from the current downward angle to align the camera horizontally, enabling observation of both the base and roof within the field of view.

To capture the full vertical span of the building, I need to adjust the pitch downward from the current upward angle to reveal the base while keeping the roof visible, enabling height estimation through vertical field-of-view alignment.
The building's full vertical span is now observable from base to roof after pitch adjustments, allowing height estimation based on standard building proportions and visible structural features.
